title: The Hairy Bakers - GHOST DOG
description:
The Hairy Bakers

Dave Myers and Simon King take to the road to find the very best in baking in Britain.
The pair travelled around Britain in search of the best sources of ingredients and the best recipes for bread, cakes, pork pies and puddings.
In this new series, Si and Dave cooked their way around Britain. How about making your own Naan bread to go with a home made curry or a gorgeous cheese and beer bread to serve with an onion and apple soup.
They made their own mark at the Womens Institute with their own interpretation of the classic Victoria sponge. I'm not sure what the WI made of it though.
It was then on to the Henley Royal Regatta to make a tea time treat for one of the crews. A tempting selection of really chunky cookies with sour cherries and chocolate chips.
Si and Dave also took on one of their biggest challenges. They were asked by a Manchester couple if they could make them a wedding cake. So it was off to Manchester to bake a traditional 5 tier fruit cake. It was so big they had to mix it in a wheel barrow! Not suprishingly though, it was a great success.

Episodes:
1. Bread - The biker Bakers mill their own flour and make a brown loaf to go with a ploughman's lunch.
2. Teatime Treats - The Hairy Bikers, Dave and Si, examine the history and conventions of tea.
3. Pies and Pasties - The duo travel from Cornwall to Scotland, cooking pasties, pork pies and fish in pastry.
4. Celebration Cakes - Simon King and Dave Myers delve into the world of celebration cakes.
5. Christmas Special
